title: Imagine a universe with different logic and mathematics, how would it look like? - Quora

response.answer_text: There’s only one fairly concrete possibility one can think of: a ‘quantum mechanical’ world. If Planck’s constant were much bigger than it is, our world would follow ‘QM logic’, which is rather peculiar. When you add one ‘apple’ to another, you might get two apples. Or, due to interference, you might get zero! Or there could be one apple, phasing in and out of existence. And other possibilities. It’s hard to describe briefly, study QM for the whole picture. In such a world our ‘normal’ mathematics would be discovered sooner or later, but it would be exotic. Much like Reimannian geometry (in this world). Considered the underlying ‘truth’ of reality but known only to a few specialists. If you don’t like that ‘alternative universe’ I can imagine many more but it’s not worth going into, the possibilities are too open-ended.

I am trying to imagine such a universe. I can imagine many universes even ones with green unicorns. You make no statement about the logic and mathematics that are in this universe. Are they logical and consistent? Do you want me to make them up for the purposes of this question? My imagination is far beyond the space that it would take to answer your question given the little info that I have.
